data.description: Advanced language practice, including intensive writing and work in pertinent areas of grammar and stylistics.
data.title: ADVANCED LANGUAGE PRACTICE

data.description: An introduction to reading and analyzing literary works, with special emphasis on development of oral and written skills for the discussion of literature. Concentration on methods of analyzing basic literary forms, conventions, genres, and representative short texts in Spanish.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO HISPANIC LITERATURES

data.description: Analysis of Latina and Latino popular culture to consider the varied make-up of Latinos, their specific histories, social dynamics and politics through their creative expressions, performances and cultural contestations. Covers key terms and concepts, cultural developments, and diverse interpretations while focusing in the analysis of Latinx music, performance art, film and media, sports, food, and car culture. Other topics include the production, circulation and reception of Latinx popular culture, the use of Spanish and English languages, issues of identity, migration and interculturality, the role of the cultural industry, and the context of globalization. Broadly explores the intersectionality of race, ethnicity, class, gender, sexuality, and nation regarding Latinos. Taught in Spanish.
data.title: SURVEY OF LATINO AND LATINA POPULAR CULTURE

data.description: Focuses on the cultural evolution of Chicanos, Puerto Ricans, Cuban-Americans, and other U.S. Latinos in relation to their countries of origin. Topics vary.
data.title: TOPICS IN LATINX CULTURE

data.description: Intensive practice in reading, writing, and grammar.
data.title: INTERMEDIATE LANGUAGE PRACTICE WITH EMPHASIS ON WRITING AND GRAMMAR

data.description: Introduction to the issues which shape the national cultures and the cultural practices of the Hispanic world. Emphasis on diversity, emergence of new imagined communities, cultural hybridity, and social movements within a historical framework.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO HISPANIC CULTURES
